## Comprehensive Markdown Example Welcome to this **extensive** Markdown document. It demonstrates a variety of Markdown syntax and elements. ## Table of Contents 1. [Text Formatting](#text-formatting) 2. [Lists](#lists) 3. [Links and Images](#links-and-images) 4. [Blockquotes](#blockquotes) 5. [Code Blocks and Inline Code](#code-blocks-and-inline-code) 6. [Tables](#tables) 7. [Horizontal Rules](#horizontal-rules) 8. [Task Lists](#task-lists) 9. [Nested Elements](#nested-elements) 10. [Miscellaneous](#miscellaneous) --- 
System.out.println("java"); 
import java.util.*;
# Text Formatting You can format text with: - **Bold** - *Italic* - ***Bold Italic*** - ~~Strikethrough~~ Example: > **Bold**, *italic*, ***both***, and ~~strikethrough~~. ## Lists ### Unordered List - Apple - Banana - Cherry - Nested Item 1 - Nested Item 2 ### Ordered List 1. First item \n 2. Second item \n 3. Third item \n ## Links and Images - [OpenAI](https://openai.com) - ![React Logo](https://reactjs.org/logo-og.png) ## Blockquotes > This is a blockquote. > > It can span multiple lines. > > > Nested blockquote inside a blockquote. ## Code Blocks and Inline Code

## Advanced Markdown Showcase

Explore the full potential of **Markdown** with this interactive guide.

## Sections

1. [Headings](#headings)
2. [Typography](#typography)
3. [Code Examples](#code-examples)
4. [Images & Media](#images--media)
5. [Tables & Data](#tables--data)
6. [Tasks](#tasks)

---

## Headings

# H1
## H2
### H3
#### H4

## Typography

- **Bold Text**
- *Italic Text*
- ***Bold Italic Text***
- ~~Strikethrough~~
- Inline code: `npm install`

> ‚ÄúMarkdown is a lightweight markup language‚Äù ‚Äî *CommonMark*

## Code Examples

### JavaScript
```javascript
function greet(name) {
  console.log(`Hello, ${name}!`);
}
greet('World');
```

### Python
```python
def greet(name):
    print(f"Hello, {name}!")

greet("World")
```

## Images & Media

![Markdown Logo](https://markdown-here.com/img/icon256.png)

## Tables & Data

| Feature       | Supported |
|--------------|-----------|
| Bold         | ‚úÖ        |
| Italic       | ‚úÖ        |
| Tables       | ‚úÖ        |
| Code Blocks  | ‚úÖ        |
| Images       | ‚úÖ        |

## Tasks

- [x] Learn markdown
- [x] Write rich content
- [ ] Integrate into app
- [ ] Review styling

---

### Footer

Visit [GitHub Markdown Guide](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/) for more info.

## Python Basics Cheatsheet üêç

Welcome to the **Python Beginner‚Äôs Cheatsheet**. This quick reference covers essential syntax and concepts.

---

## üìå Getting Started

```python
print("Hello, Python World!")
```

## üì¶ Variables & Data Types

```python
name = "Alice"   # String
grade = 95        # Integer
height = 5.6      # Float
is_active = True  # Boolean
```

## üß∞ Common Data Structures

- **List**: `fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"]`
- **Tuple**: `point = (10, 20)`
- **Set**: `unique_nums = {1, 2, 3}`
- **Dictionary**: `person = {"name": "Bob", "age": 25}`

## üîÅ Control Flow

```python
for i in range(5):
    print(i)

if grade > 90:
    print("Excellent!")
else:
    print("Keep trying!")
```

## üß™ Functions

```python
def greet(name):
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

print(greet("Alice"))
```

## üóÇÔ∏è File Handling

```python
with open("file.txt", "r") as file:
    data = file.read()
    print(data)
```

## ‚úÖ Checklist

- [x] Learn variables
- [x] Practice loops
- [ ] Explore modules
- [ ] Build small projects

## üìé Reference Links

- [Python Docs](https://docs.python.org/3/)
- [W3Schools Python](https://www.w3schools.com/python/)
